intro: Centaurea cichoracea, commonly known as the Italian chicory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny bracts that surround the central flower head. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Centaurea cichoracea is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine.
